{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3534725,"name":"Miles.D","username":"jom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T21:20:33.916Z","cooked":"

Can you use a rev thru bore encoder for a kraken? My teammate says we can do it with a candi but are there any other ways?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T21:20:33.916Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":66,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":346.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492483,"topic_slug":"using-a-rev-thru-bore-encoder-with-a-kraken","display_username":"Miles.D","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68136,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3039 Team captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-a-rev-thru-bore-encoder-with-a-kraken/492483/1","custom_user_title":"3039 Team captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3534743,"name":"","username":"trashgoblin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trashgoblin/{size}/234495_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T21:47:35.405Z","cooked":"

I assume what you mean is using the throughbore encoder on a mechanism with only krakens, which is possible without a CANdi (if I understand correctly, I haven’t used these outside of FTC). Looking at Rev’s documentation, it seems to be usable by just plugging into the roboRIO’s DIO ports.

image960×960 77.1 KB

(note that that pic is in absolute config, need to wire differently for relative if you want that)

It could be possible if you combine both of these diagrams

It depends on what you want to do with it. I got it to work with the closed loop position control without extra hardware. Details of what I did can be found here. setPosition not working? - #16 by ebear11
